messages.message: getting weird errors when trying to install gevent on python3.7 — anyone else seen this? I think @Kerry hit it earlier this week as well.
@dlluncor did you need to upgrade gevent for app-tasks to run on 3.7?
upgrading to the next version (`1.3.0`) seems to fix this

yep yep — here are all the libraries I upgraded to get things working with Python 3.7 — i encapsulated them here — and you can technically pip install everything by pip installing the PY37 requirements in a PY 3.7 venv - https://github.com/instabase/instabase/blob/master/tools/devtools/code-dependencies/python/python37-install-dev.sh

aaah thx — useful to know, the PRs you’d linked to in the emails did leave me a bit confused as to what versions you’d upgraded to @dlluncor. i’ll let you know if i run into problems mirroring those upgrades for image-tasks/webdriver/docops.

i’m confused where you made your updates @dlluncor — i don’t see changes implied by that `python37-install-dev.sh` script in the `requirements.base.in (http://requirements.base.in)` file for `app-tasks`
but i think `kombu` is missing from your list — we need to push it to at least 4.4.0 for python3.7.
chetan and I clarified over phone — all good
@Chetan anything look risky from the changelogs?
hard to gauge because i have no clue how the libraries are used really. there’s definitely many breaking changes.
